note.p: Career: Commissioner for Assessment for North Riding of Yorkshire (1661-1680, 1689-1690), Essex (1663-1664), Westmoreland (1679-1680); MP for Appleby (1679)
Date of ejection/withdrawal: 9 August 1682 (due to non-payment of subscriptions)
References: T L Underwood, 'Quakers and the Royal Society of London in the Seventeenth Century' in NR 1976-7 vol 31 pp 133-150

Notes: The election date is Lowther's re-election date into the Society after the grant of the second charter in April 1663. All Fellows admitted in a two-month window after this charter, until 22 June 1663, are considered Original Fellows. He was previously elected on 22 April 1662 and admitted into the Society on 29 April 1662.
